intro: Anemonella thalictroides f. rosea, commonly known as the pink form of the common anemonella, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant features delicate, trifoliate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or rose-colored. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its charming appearance.
